note: Imran Khan Niazi, born on October 5, 1952, in Lahore, Pakistan, is a prominent figure in Pakistani politics and sports. He rose to international fame as a cricketer, leading Pakistan to victory in the 1992 Cricket World Cup. After retiring from cricket, Khan entered politics, founding the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party in 1996. He became the Prime Minister of Pakistan in 2018, promising to tackle corruption and implement reforms for a better Pakistan
